body_content.explanation: to take part in a video conference (= a meeting at which two or more people who are in different places can talk to and see each other using electronic technology) to which you have not been invited, often with the intention of interrupting and annoying the people in the meeting:
examples: A high school in Massachusetts is taking measures after a person “Zoom bombed” a class on the first day of school.
Are you worried that someone will zoombomb your class or meeting?
Have you been Zoom-bombed yet? If you haven't, you're one of the lucky ones.
